comment: I just didnt understand his teaching try asking questions but just cant understand will not take him again

He has 3 exams and 1 final. He drops your lowest exam of the first 3. All the exams are worth 24% (96% of your grade comes from exams) and the other 4% comes from attendance. Went to class the first day and then only on the exam days. Made a 97% overall grade. Studied the practice problems he gives before each exam.

He's pretty good, but I wouldn't say he is the best. He gives you practice exams for each exam to help you study, even though they are a bit too long. Just  study those and you will end up with an A. There are 4 exams and he drops the lowest one. I don't really have many complaints about this guy, except that he can be hard to understand at times.

Pretty easy teacher! If you work on the study guides and throughly understand the information you dont have to go to class. Going to class IS helpful, and tests are not hard at all. He wont round your grade up at all though! Id take him again!

I got an A in ths class. His notes do not relate to the tests at all so dont bother taking them. all you have to do is read the chapters, which will help you answer the quizzes. the quizzes in addiition to replacing a test grade in compilation, are where he gets his test questions from. they are exactly the same!!! attendance is4 bonus point.10 pts

He tries to make the class easy. There are optional quizzes online that can replace your lowest test grade (so basically your lowest test grade will become a 100). I feel like he did not teach us what was going to be on the tests though. Curves the tests and gives bonus points for attendance. If it werent for those bonus points I would never go...

Absolutely the WORST professor that I have ever had. I went to every class for the first few weeks, after the 1st & 2nd test, I was failing. When I stopped going to class except on test day, I got A's, just by doing the study guide on my own time. Study guides required a lot of outside research. Notes & textbook DON'T HELP AT ALL & they take hours

His tests are hard but he always curves them. If you study the power points you will be fine, you do not need Commanding Heights or the textbook to do well. I made an A. He is funny, smart, and very personable. He does not have an accent that is hard to understand. I really enjoyed him. Attendance points help.

Attendance is not mandatory. Get the textbook if you would rather study by reading than by going over power points. Tests are extremely hard. I read every chapter covered for exam 2 and understood the material and got a D. Can't understand him because he is foreign. In my opinion, the class set-up and grading are similar to science 1101 and 1102.

Tests and Powerpoints are written by the book's creator, who is horrible at writing straightforward questions.  He gave us links to the book's website, which has lots of helpful stuff.  You can't understand Mirza, but if you complain enough, he will give you everything you need to pass.

Laziest professor I have ever had!! Everyone was failing after the 1st test so the last 3 were based on online quizzes that were extra  credit. The test questions are the quizzes, so focus on finding the answers to study for the test, class ppt are pointless. But go to class cause he takes roll every day and worth extra credit. Ended up with an A!!
Easy A/B read the book and show up on test days.

He's nice but boring at times. I went to his classes only to sign the attendence sheet which he passes around randomly for 10 bonus pts. Didn't really need the book even though I had it. final is mandatory! he'll only drop your lowest grade from the first 3 tests. Most ppl found the final difficult though. Easy class, take him if you can

I've had other econ teachers, and they were awful compared to Mirza.  He explains things extremely well and will go over it again if you don't understand.  I'd suggest going to class.  It does help a lot, and it's not that boring.  nice guy.  definitely recommend this teacher.

I enjoy his way of teaching. His notes are crystal clear and VALUABLE.I didn't have a book and passed his class using the notes.Even with the book, he breaks it down. I took him on Sat.for 5 hrs during the Summer. I never missed a day, because I knew his notes would help me pass the test. He add 10 points to your average for attendance.Take him!LG

He teaches straight from the book and gives book tests.  Just get the text read it and show up on test days.  He curves every test and only counts your best 3 grades, so you can exempt the final.  He is an easy A or B.

I have taken Mirza for Mirco and Macro and know that he is a better teacher in Mirco. I got an A in Micro and a B in Macro. I recommend him if you dont want to go to class and take notes but rather study the book on your own. His test questions are very lame and judgemental towards the book and notes. Take him if you want at least a B.
Very cool way of teaching....you gotta learn lots of graphs but as long as you're in class...easy A!!

Boring. The only thing I remember him talking about is Reaganomics. There are 4 tests and he takes the top 3, so I didn't even take one of the tests. I never paid attention to him, I just went home and read and made a "B". He gives 10 extra credit points for attendance and he started taking roll in the middle of semester?

Very, Very Easy class as on average he adds 6-10 points to your test grades if you show up the day after the test.  I should have got a 93, but with bonuses ended up with a 99. He only counts your top 3 tests as well so do good on the first 3 and don't worry about the final. The class sucks, but if you want an A take it.
Excellent Teacher

Really good proffesor,easy going, explains everything, test comes from the book and things he emphasizes in class, gives alot of extra points, even for going to class, specially day after tests, pass the first three exams and don't have to take final.
